column5: Anyone know the different between maggot and wax worm? Also there is a brownise half finger size worm and do you know what they call(anyone use this kind of worm for panfish)? Where can I buy those worm in Toronto area?  Thanks in advance!
Maggots are fly larva and wax worms are larva of the wax moth.
Meal worms is part 2 of your questions. These can be found at your local pet store. (Ask for dragon food).
Waxworms don't stay on the hook well and are costly.  Mealworms are dirt cheap... they also have super worms, which are mealworms on steroids and can bite.
The taste.   Okay, I'll go now...
I disagree...they both taste like chicken to me. LOL...maybe i should fix my fridge.
I thought one was a type of bait and the other was a type of lawyer, no?
